bug.author: InCogNiTo124
bug.summary: kfctl shows wrong version in v0.6.1
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] Downloaded the latest release from the release page but the printed version does not match the downloaded <denchmark-code>cd /tmp wget https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/download/v0.6.1/kfctl_v0.6.1_linux.tar.gz tar xvf kfctl_v0.6.1* ./kfctl version > kfctl v0.6.1-rc.2-1-g3a37cbc6 </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: it should print out kfctl v0.6.1 Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Although a minor issue, it could create confusion in the next releases. Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): v0.6.1 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.1-rc2-1-g3a37cbc6 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) aws eks Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version):
<denchmark-code>Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12", GitVersion:"v1.12.7", GitCommit:"6f482974b76db3f1e0f5d24605a9d1d38fad9a2b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-03-29T16:15:10Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12+", GitVersion:"v1.12.6-eks-d69f1b", GitCommit:"d69f1bf3669bf00b7f4a758e978e0e7a1e3a68f7", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-02-28T20:26:10Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} </denchmark-code>
OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Amazon Linux AMI 2018.03.
